ExamplesÂ¶

  1from urllib import request
  2from goblet import Goblet, jsonify, Response, goblet_entrypoint
  3from goblet.infrastructures.alerts import (
  4    MetricCondition,
  5    LogMatchCondition,
  6    CustomMetricCondition,
  7)
  8import asyncio
  9import logging
 10
 11app = Goblet(function_name="goblet-example", region="us-central-1")
 12app.log.setLevel(logging.INFO)  # configure goblet logger level
 13goblet_entrypoint(app)
 14
 15from typing import List
 16from marshmallow import Schema, fields
 17
 18# Example http trigger
 19@app.http()
 20def main(request):
 21    return jsonify(request.json)
 22
 23
 24# Example http trigger that contains header
 25@app.http(headers={"X-Github-Event"})
 26def main(request):
 27    return jsonify(request.json)
 28
 29
 30# Example http triggers that matches header
 31@app.http(headers={"X-Github-Event": "issue"})
 32def main(request):
 33    return jsonify(request.json)
 34
 35
 36# Path param
 37@app.route("/home/{test}")
 38def home(test):
 39    return jsonify(test)
 40
 41
 42# Example query args
 43@app.route("/home")
 44def query_args():
 45    request = app.current_request
 46    q = request.args.get("q")
 47    return jsonify(q)
 48
 49
 50# POST request
 51@app.route("/home", methods=["POST"])
 52def post():
 53    request = app.current_request
 54    return jsonify(request.json)
 55
 56
 57# Typed Path Param
 58@app.route("/home/{name}/{id}", methods=["GET"])
 59def namer(name: str, id: int):
 60    return f"{name}: {id}"
 61
 62
 63class Point(Schema):
 64    lat = fields.Int()
 65    lng = fields.Int()
 66
 67
 68# Custom schema types
 69@app.route("/points")
 70def points() -> List[Point]:
 71    point = Point().load({"lat": 0, "lng": 0})
 72    return [point]
 73
 74
 75# Custom Marshmallow Fields
 76from marshmallow_enum import EnumField
 77from enum import Enum
 78
 79
 80def enum_to_properties(self, field, **kwargs):
 81    """
 82    Add an OpenAPI extension for marshmallow_enum.EnumField instances
 83    """
 84    if isinstance(field, EnumField):
 85        return {"type": "string", "enum": [m.name for m in field.enum]}
 86    return {}
 87
 88
 89app.handlers["route"].marshmallow_attribute_function = enum_to_properties
 90
 91
 92class StopLight(Enum):
 93    green = 1
 94    yellow = 2
 95    red = 3
 96
 97
 98class TrafficStop(Schema):
 99    light_color = EnumField(StopLight)
100
101
102@app.route("/traffic")
103def traffic() -> TrafficStop:
104    return TrafficStop().dump({"light_color": StopLight.green})
105
106
107# Returns follow openapi spec
108# definitions:
109#   TrafficStop:
110#     type: object
111#     properties:
112#       light_color:
113#         type: string
114#         enum:
115#         - green
116#         - yellow
117#         - red
118
119# Pydantic Typing
120from pydantic import BaseModel
121
122
123class NestedModel(BaseModel):
124    text: str
125
126
127class PydanticModel(BaseModel):
128    id: int
129    nested: NestedModel
130
131
132# Request Body Typing
133@app.route("/pydantic", request_body=PydanticModel)
134def traffic() -> PydanticModel:
135    return jsonify(PydanticModel().dict)
136
137
138# Custom Backend
139@app.route("/custom_backend", backend="https://www.CLOUDRUN_URL.com/home")
140def custom_backend():
141    return
142
143
144# Method Security
145@app.route("/method_security", security=[{"your_custom_auth_id": []}])
146def method_security():
147    return
148
149
150# Custom responses and request_types
151@app.route(
152    "/custom",
153    request_body={
154        "application/json": {"schema": {"type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}
155    },
156    responses={"400": {"description": "400"}},
157)
158def custom():
159    request = app.current_request
160    assert request.data["string1", "string2"]
161    return
162
163
164# Example response object
165@app.route("/response")
166def response():
167    return Response(
168        {"failed": 400}, headers={"Content-Type": "application/json"}, status_code=400
169    )
170
171
172# Scheduled job
173@app.schedule("5 * * * *")
174def scheduled_job():
175    return jsonify("success")
176
177
178# Scheduled job with custom headers, method, and body
179@app.schedule(
180    "5 * * * *",
181    httpMethod="POST",
182    headers={"X-Custom": "header"},
183    body="BASE64 ENCODED STRING",
184)
185def scheduled_job():
186    headers = app.current_request.headers
187    body = app.current_request.body
188    method = app.current_request.method
189    return jsonify("success")
190
191
192# Pubsub topic
193@app.topic("test")
194def topic(data):
195    app.log.info(data)
196    return
197
198
199# Pubsub topic with matching message attributes
200@app.topic("test", attributes={"key": "value"})
201def pubsub_attributes(data):
202    app.log.info(data)
203    return
204
205
206# create a pubsub subscription instead of pubsub triggered function
207@app.topic("test", use_subscription=True)
208def pubsub_subscription_use_subscription(data):
209    return
210
211
212# create a pubsub subscription instead of pubsub triggered function and add filter
213@app.topic(
214    "test",
215    use_subscription=True,
216    filter='attributes.name = "com" AND -attributes:"iana.org/language_tag"',
217)
218def pubsub_subscription_filter(data):
219    return
220
221
222# Example Storage trigger on the create/finalize event
223@app.storage("BUCKET_NAME", "finalize")
224def storage(event):
225    app.log.info(event)
226    return
227
228
229# Example before request
230@app.before_request()
231def add_db(request):
232    app.g.db = "db"
233    return request
234
235
236# Example after request
237@app.after_request()
238def add_header(response):
239    response.headers["X-Custom"] = "custom header"
240    return response
241
242
243# Example eventarc pubsub topic
244@app.eventarc(topic="test")
245def pubsub(data):
246    app.log.info("pubsub")
247    return
248
249
250# Example eventarc direct event
251@app.eventarc(
252    event_filters=[
253        {"attribute": "type", "value": "google.cloud.storage.object.v1.finalized"},
254        {"attribute": "bucket", "value": "BUCKET"},
255    ],
256    region="us-east1",
257)
258def bucket(data):
259    app.log.info("bucket_post")
260    return
261
262
263# Example eventarc audit log
264@app.eventarc(
265    event_filters=[
266        {"attribute": "type", "value": "google.cloud.audit.log.v1.written"},
267        {"attribute": "methodName", "value": "storage.objects.get"},
268        {"attribute": "serviceName", "value": "storage.googleapis.com"},
269    ],
270    region="us-central1",
271)
272def bucket_get(data):
273    app.log.info("bucket_get")
274    return
275
276
277# Example Cloudrun Job with schedule
278@app.job("job1", schedule="* * * * *")
279def job1_task1(id):
280    app.log.info(f"job...{id}")
281    return "200"
282
283
284# Example Cloudrun Job with additional task
285@app.job("job1", task_id=1)
286def job1_task2(id):
287    app.log.info(f"different task for job...{id}")
288    return "200"
289
290
291# Example BQ Remote Function
292# Called in BQ with the following sql: SELECT `PROJECT.DATASET.math_example_multiply(x,y,z)` from DATASET.table
293@app.bqremotefunction(dataset_id="DATASET")
294def multiply(x: int, y: int, z: int) -> int:
295    w = x * y * z
296    return w
297
298# Totally contrived example of an async function (a real one would use aiohttp or similar)
299async def async_multiply(x: int, y: int) -> int:
300    w = x * y
301    return w
302
303# Example BQ Remote Function with vectorized function
304# For network-bound BQ Remote Functions, this approach using async will yield significantly better performance
305@app.bqremotefunction(dataset_id="blogs",vectorize_func=True)
306def function_test(x: List[int], y: List[int]) -> List[int]:
307     results = [asyncio.run(async_multiply(elem_x, elem_y)) for elem_x, elem_y in zip(x, y)]
308     return results
309
310
311# Example Redis Instance
312app.redis("redis-test")
313
314# Example VPC Connector
315app.vpcconnector("vpc-conn-test")
316
317# Example Metric Alert for the cloudfunction metric execution_count with a threshold of 10
318app.alert(
319    "metric",
320    conditions=[
321        MetricCondition(
322            "test",
323            metric="cloudfunctions.googleapis.com/function/execution_count",
324            value=10,
325        )
326    ],
327)
328
329# Example Metric Alert for the cloudfunction metric execution_times with a Delta type with a threshold of 1000 ms
330app.alert(
331    "metric",
332    conditions=[
333        MetricCondition(
334            "test",
335            metric="cloudfunctions.googleapis.com/function/execution_times",
336            value=1000,
337            aggregations=[
338                {
339                    "alignmentPeriod": "300s",
340                    "crossSeriesReducer": "REDUCE_NONE",
341                    "perSeriesAligner": "ALIGN_PERCENTILE_50",
342                }
343            ],
344        )
345    ],
346)
347
348# Example Log Match metric that will trigger an incendent off of any Error logs
349app.alert("error", conditions=[LogMatchCondition("error", "severity>=ERROR")])
350
351# Example Metric Alert that creates a custom metric for severe errors with http code in the 500's and creates an alert with a threshold of 10
352app.alert(
353    "custom",
354    conditions=[
355        CustomMetricCondition(
356            "custom",
357            metric_filter="severity=(ERROR OR CRITICAL OR ALERT OR EMERGENCY) httpRequest.status=(500 OR 501 OR 502 OR 503 OR 504)",
358            value=10,
359        )
360    ],
361)
362
363
364# Example CloudTask Queue + CloudTask HTTP Target
365client = app.cloudtaskqueue("queue", config={
366    "rateLimits": {
367        "maxDispatchesPerSecond": 500,
368        "maxBurstSize": 100,
369        "maxConcurrentDispatches": 1000
370    },
371    "retryConfig": {
372        "maxAttempts": 10,
373        "minBackoff": "0.100s",
374        "maxBackoff": "3600s",
375        "maxDoublings": 16
376    }
377})
378
379@app.cloudtasktarget(name="target")
380def my_target_handler(request):
381    ''' handle request '''
382    return {}
383
384
385@app.route("/enqueue", methods=["GET"])
386def enqueue():
387    payload = {"message": {"title": "enqueue"}}
388    client.enqueue(target="target", payload=payload)
389    return {}
